author: time news
title: This Thursday bus drivers are going on strike to demand early retirement
text:
City, intercity and state‚Äå bus drivers‚Å¢ will continue their general ‚Å§strike across Spain on Thursday‚Å£ and friday, November‚Å£ 28 and 29‚Å§ to demand‚Å§ early retirement in the ‚Å£sector, with minimum services set‚Å§ at 50% at state level.
According to ‚Äçthe‚Äã resolution on minimum services‚Äç of‚Äã the Ministry of Transport and Urban Mobility, 50% of currently authorized shipments will have to be carried out. If it is indeed a route consisting of a single‚Å£ shipment, it will‚Äç be carried out in its entirety.
Major companies providing long-distance ‚Å£bus services‚Äã will contact ticket‚Äå holders whose service has‚Å£ had to‚Äå be suspended,offering them ‚Å£a free exchange.
This is the second‚Äã day of a total of seven‚Å¢ days‚Äç announced, after the one that took‚Å£ place on October 28th. ‚Å£It was also scheduled for November‚Äå 11th but was canceled due‚Äã to the effects of DANA.
On this‚Äå occasion it is supported by the CCOO, which represent over ‚Å£40% of the sector, and ‚Å£by the ‚ÄåCGT, after UGT and ‚ÄçSLT withdrew from the ‚Äãtender after having signed a commitment with ‚Äåthe employers‚Äô‚Äå associations Confeb√∫s, Anetra and Atuc to ‚Äçask for the early retirement to‚Äã administrations once a royal ‚Å¢decree comes into force.
For CCOO this commitment ‚Äåis not enough,since the date has been tied to the approval of that royal decree,presumably in February,but ‚Å§it could be later. The‚Å§ union ‚Äçalso claims that in the rest of the transport sectors, such as road‚Äã haulage, the commitment was ‚Å¢to request it within 20 days.
Minimum self-reliant services Autonomous ‚Äãcommunities and city councils have also established‚Äã minimum services in‚Äå their respective regions. For example, in Catalonia they will‚Äç be ‚Å£40% ‚Äãduring peak hours and 20% during‚Å¢ the rest, ‚Äçwhile in Madrid intercity buses will carry out 80% of their services ‚Å¢during peak ‚Å£hours and 45% during off-peak ‚Å£hours.
Likewise, ‚Äãin Cantabria they‚Äã will‚Äã be 30%, in Navarra 40% and in ‚Å£Gran Canaria 50%. As for‚Å§ the cities, for example in ‚ÄåPalma it will be 50%, in‚Äç Pamplona ‚Äå60% during peak ‚Äçhours and 40% during off-peak hours, and‚Äå in M√©rida 50%.
After this Thursday ‚Äãand‚Å§ Friday, the strike will resume on December 5 and 9, and ‚Å§from ‚ÄåDecember 23 indefinitely if an agreement‚Å¢ between unions and employers is not reached ‚Å¢first.
How could the bus ‚Å£driver strike affect public ‚Å¢transportation in Spain in ‚Äåthe long term? Interview: Understanding the ongoing Bus driver Strike in Spain
Time.news Editor: Today, we have the‚Äç pleasure of speaking wiht Dr. Laura Mart√≠nez, a‚Å§ transport policy expert, to‚Äç shed light on the current strike by city, intercity, and state bus drivers in Spain. Thank you for ‚Äçjoining us, Dr.Mart√≠nez.
Dr.‚Å§ Laura Mart√≠nez: ‚Å§ thank you for having me. Its crucial to discuss these critical developments in the‚Å¢ transport‚Äå sector.
Editor: The bus drivers are striking on November 28 ‚Äåand 29, demanding early retirement. can you explain why this strike is happening now and the importance of these demands?
Dr. Mart√≠nez: Certainly. This strike is actually‚Å§ part ‚Äçof a broader ongoing movement, with a ‚Å£total of seven strike‚Äå days announced. The bus drivers,‚Å¢ represented mainly ‚Å§by CCOO, are pushing for early retirement due to the demanding nature of their work and to ensure a more sustainable workforce in the long term. This demand is particularly poignant as they believe previous agreements with ‚Å¢employers weren‚Äôt sufficient and wanted a firm timeline for action against‚Äã this issue.
Editor: You mentioned the companies‚Äô commitment to provide minimum‚Äå services; can you elaborate on what that means for ‚Äåcommuters?
Dr. Mart√≠nez: Under the Ministry of ‚Å£Transport ‚Äãand Urban Mobility‚Äôs regulations, a minimum of 50% of authorized bus services ‚Äçmust still operate at ‚Å¢the state level during the strike. However, we see variations ‚Å£in ‚Å£minimum services across regions‚Äîlike 40% during peak ‚Äãhours in catalonia, for example. This means that while the strike will impact service availability, some buses will still be running, although commuters should expect longer wait times and reduced options.
editor: What should passengers know‚Äã if their bus service ‚Å¢is affected?
Dr. Mart√≠nez: Passengers should keep an eye on‚Äã communications from‚Äã their bus service providers. Major companies have committed to contacting ticket holders whose services are suspended and ‚Å¢will offer ‚Äãfree exchanges for alternative ‚Äçtravel. Thus, it‚Äôs vital for commuters to stay informed and consider flexible travel options during this‚Å§ period of disruption.
Editor: The situation seems tense with ‚Äãongoing negotiations. What are the implications if an agreement isn‚Äôt reached soon?
Dr. Mart√≠nez: If the‚Å¢ unions and employers‚Å§ cannot come to a satisfactory agreement, ‚Äãthe strike could escalate, with services‚Å¢ likely ceasing indefinitely from December 23. This would ‚Å¢severely disrupt transportation for many who rely on these services daily. The situation highlights the‚Å§ urgent need for meaningful dialog and rapid policy responses from the government to address the labor concerns in the ‚Å¢transport sector.
Editor: Could this strike have‚Å§ ripple effects ‚Å£on ‚Å§the broader transport industry in Spain?
Dr.Mart√≠nez: Absolutely. Strikes in essential services like‚Å¢ public transport frequently enough have a domino effect, impacting not just commuters but also local economies that depend on reliable transport. Additionally,if the calls for early retirement are met,we‚Äå could see shifts in workforce dynamics across the entire transport sector,including increased pressure on governmental agencies to outline retirement‚Äç policies.
Editor: Considering these developments, what practical advice can you give‚Äå to commuters ‚Å§in Spain during this strike?
Dr. Mart√≠nez: Commuters ‚Å£should plan their travel in advance and consider alternate routes or‚Å§ modes of transport. It‚Äôs also beneficial to check real-time updates from service providers and remain adaptable as schedules ‚Å§could change frequently. Most importantly, staying engaged with ‚Äçthe news surrounding the strike will help commuters make informed decisions.
Editor: Thank you, Dr. Mart√≠nez,for your insights into this pressing issue.The bus driver strike not only affects daily‚Å§ commuters but‚Äã also raises significant questions about labor rights and transportation policy in ‚ÄåSpain.
Dr. Mart√≠nez: Thank you for having me. It‚Äôs essential to keep discussing these issues as they evolve.

author: ElNacional.cat
title: La racha de lluvias y la alteraci\u00f3n mar\u00edtima se alargar\u00e1n en Catalunya el fin de semana
text: Punto final de un octubre excepcional que ha sido lluvioso en Catalunya con m√°s de 100 litros a un 70% del territorio y m√°ximos de 400 litros en los Ports. Est√° claro que nunca llueve al gusto de todo el mundo, o como dir√≠a el artista Raimon Pelegero, "En el meu pa√≠s no sap ploure". Noviembre continuar√° la racha lluviosa, como m√≠nimo durante el fin de semana por un flujo de levante con mucho recorrido mar√≠timo que transportar√° lluvias de mar hacia tierra. De hecho, la atm√≥sfera se mantiene removida y almacena mucho vapor de agua con un mar Mediterr√°neo todav√≠a bastante templado que puede dar un plus de energ√≠a a las precipitaciones. No baj√©is la vigilancia y estad precavidos, llover√° sobre mojado en muchas comarcas y todav√≠a hay riesgo de aguaceros, fen√≥menos extremos o tiempo violento. Te explicamos todos los detalles en el siguiente v√≠deo: Lluvias y paraguas La previsi√≥n del tiempo para el fin de semana anuncia un tiempo inestable y lluvioso en media Catalunya. Cielo cubierto en la costa y el prelitoral con lluvias intermitentes, el s√°bado m√°s probables, organizadas y frecuentes en las comarcas de Girona y de Tarragona, mientras que el domingo tambi√©n podr√≠a llover a c√°ntaros en Barcelona. El grueso de lluvias volver√° a concentrarse en las Terres de l'Ebre y en el sur de Catalunya con tormentas y aguaceros, mientras que tambi√©n podr√≠a llover d√©bilmente en el interior, pero de forma m√°s inconexa y dispersa. Las precipitaciones se desplazar√°n de mar hacia tierra, procedentes del sudeste. Viento moderado de levante o gregal en la costa y d√©bil en el interior con alg√∫n claro testimonial. La temperatura no presentar√° movimiento y continuar√° el ambiente suave de oto√±o, sin nada de fresco. Vigilad si v√°is a las playas, continuar√° el mar alterado con olas de 1 a 3 metros de altura. Bon dia! ‚Äî Jordi Hern√°ez Sard√† (@jordihernaez)[#ElPortdelaSelva][#ElTemps3Cat][@SoniaPapell][@eltempsTV3][@meteorac1][@alexmegapc][@meteocat][@TAIKOmeteo][@MeteoBarrufet][@Meteo_Roses][@MeteoEmporda][@alcantara_alb][@tramuntana_tv][@SeguimlaMeteo][@GrupCMI][@AEMET_Cat][@gemmapuigf][@MarcSilvestre7][@Vakapiupiu][@P4Estacions][pic.twitter.com/BOUIExixmI][November 1, 2024] B dia ‚Äî Francesc Mill√°n (@francescmillan)[@MeteoBarrufet][@meteocat][@MeteoMauri][@meteorac1][@ARAmeteo][@nestor_meteo][@aria_meteo][@AEMET_Cat][@AlfredRPico][@TAIKOmeteo][@gemmapuigf][@TomasMolinaB][@SoniaPapell][@SergiLoras][@eltempsTV3][@elnacionalcat][@1967fct][@efojea1][@javioru][pic.twitter.com/NMQXt26XMa][November 1, 2024] ¬°Buenos d√≠as, primeras luces del d√≠a encima de las Tuques d'Ixeia! ¬°El bosque vestido con las mejores galas! ‚Äî Jordi Campos (@jordicampos)[#tardor]La m√≠nima 7,2 grados.[#Benasque][#Ben√°s][#Pirineu][#Meteo][pic.twitter.com/B2D6Dcg0Gz][November 1, 2024] 6:40 AM. Despegue de Mallorca hacia Suiza. Mirad qu√© tormenta nos hemos encontrado entre Catalunya y Menorca. ‚õàÔ∏è ‚Äî V√≠ctor F√©rriz Pablo (@VictorFerriz)[pic.twitter.com/6KVLdmfQuD][November 1, 2024] Mejor√≠a del tiempo El anticicl√≥n absorber√° parte de Catalunya la pr√≥xima semana y el tiempo ir√° mejorando progresivamente. Lunes todav√≠a con restos de inestabilidad en la costa con alguna lluvia cada vez m√°s local y d√©bil, mientras que se abrir√°n grandes claros en el interior y los Pirineos. Si bien el martes podr√≠a llover en las comarcas de Girona y, preferentemente, en la Costa Brava, parece que la situaci√≥n se estabilizar√° en el Ebro despu√©s de muchos d√≠as consecutivos de lluvia. La temperatura subir√° un poco porque el sol calentar√° m√°s y tambi√©n se formar√°n nieblas en el interior y valles. Posible tregua entre el mi√©rcoles y el jueves con bajas probabilidades de lluvia y m√°s ratos de sol, a la espera de un nuevo cambio de tiempo que llegar√≠a por la segunda mitad de semana, todav√≠a para definir. La mala mar tambi√©n ir√° lentamente de bajada a mediados de semana y el pr√≥ximo fin de semana podr√≠a volver a alterarse. Os lo explicaremos desde el tiempo de ElNacional.cat. Cielos esta ma√±ana del viernes 1 de noviembre por Sant Pere de Vilamajor. ‚Äî Jordi Rodoreda Ros√†s (@jordirodoreda3)[pic.twitter.com/cjASNhfPld][November 1, 2024] ¬°Buen viernes! D√≠a de cielo nuevamente mucho variable‚õÖ‚òÅÔ∏è sin descartar alguna gota/chaparr√≥n breve. Ambiente suave. ‚Äî meteocad√≠ (@meteocadi) ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ S√°bado con ratos de todo, paso de nubes procedentes de levante, pero tambi√©n ratos de sol. ‚òÅÔ∏è Cielo m√°s nublado el domingo ‚ÑπÔ∏è √ìptimo crom√°tico[#tardor]ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ...[pic.twitter.com/FNfhwidjEq][November 1, 2024] Buenos d√≠as, empezamos noviembre en 5.4¬∫C de m√≠nima. ‚Äî Jordi Queralt (@meteopuigcerda) Datos meteo completos[https://t.co/IRqI1dDU86] ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Puigcerd√†, webcam Queixans.[pic.twitter.com/OKHUXTdHxx][November 1, 2024] Acabamos de recibir un nuevo aviso en el ‚Äî Agust√≠ Descarrega (Delta del Ebro ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ) (@agus_descarrega)[#DeltaDelEbre][@emergenciescat][#Deltebre]01/11/24 14h00[@eltempsTV3][@TomasMolinaB][@alcantara_alb][@MeteoMauri][@Vakapiupiu][@gemmapuigf][@elmonarac1][@alexmegapc][@meteopolita][@AlfredRPico][@SoniaPapell][@SergiLoras][@Canal21Ebre][@tempsdemeteo][pic.twitter.com/4ujY8Od8y5][November 1, 2024] üå≥ ¬øEst√°s comprometido con la sostenibilidad de nuestro planeta? Nosotros tambi√©n. Por eso te invitamos a nuestra [comunidad GreeN](https://www.elnacional.cat/es/sociedad/quieres-calcular-huella-carbono_1045074_102.html) donde podr√°s calcular tu huella de carbono y reducirla plantando √°rboles.

author: , Burlington County Times
title: Watch as thousands gather at massive iftar table to break Ramadan fast
text: Video shows thousands gathering for mass iftar in Cairo's Matareya neighborhood The streets of Cairo's Matareya neighborhood were lined with hundreds of tables as thousands gathered to break their fast together on the 15th of Ramadan. The annual community meal has been growing ever since it began in 2012 and has been dubbed the longest iftar table in Egypt. The event has taken place every except for two years during the COVID-19 pandemic, [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/egypt-cairo-biggest-iftar-ramadan-muslim-holy-month-in-matareya/?linkId=375865201&fbclid=IwAR30GuXfRu5gY58vG09SshxjEi-f8WqFjV0DMQe5rLliUqkrP1hh___GO9k_aem_AUIl_uI0m2Fa7d3yOvvul3lomGpKLS6JGHZtFmyh3G9V1ohArSC_wjk6LHqnroASeqR-a8yie8LuWMv_Tgdu1rN-) reported. There is no official count of how many people took part in the Matareya iftar, but organizers said as many as 30,000 people attended, [Egypt Today](https://www.egypttoday.com/Article/1/131260/Matariyah-iftar-banquet-manifests-ingenuity-of-Egyptian-people-PM-Madbouli) reported. This year's event featured around 700 tables that stretched for more than half a mile across seven alleyways, [Gulf News](https://gulfnews.com/world/mena/egypt-10000-feast-at-cairos-matariya-mega-iftar-on-10th-anniversary-1.101903343) reported. Footage of the event showed packed streets lit with brightly colored Ramadan decorations lining the alleyways of the neighborhood in the eastern part of Cairo. When is Ramadan 2024?: [What is it? Muslims set to mark a month of spirituality, reflection](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/03/08/ramadan-2024-when-what/72866014007/) Began with just a few neighbors At its start, the event was just a handful of neighbors breaking their fast together. Hamada Hassan told CBS News that no one had enough space in their home to host everyone, so they set up tables outside. It only continued to grow from there. Gulf News reported organizers begin preparing for the event around two months in advance every year. Preparations include everything from gathering necessary supplies to feed a whole neighborhood, to cleaning and decorating the streets, CBS News reported. Ahmed Ekram, an organizer said this year 10,000 meals were served, Gulf News reported, citing local media. Some in attendance didn't eat, but went to simply enjoy the camaraderie, CBS News reported. Local donations fund the costs of the event, which over the years has seen politicians, celebrities, and diplomats in attendance. ‚ÄúWe do not care about the cost, as all the residents of the neighborhood participate in financing the table in order to bring joy and happiness to the people of the region and other neighboring areas," Ahmed Khalaf, one of the organizers of the 2023 event told [Arab News](https://www.arabnews.com/node/2284791/middle-east) at the time.

author: La Gaceta
title: "Dibu" Mart√≠nez lo hizo otra vez: ataj√≥ dos penales y enloqueci√≥ a los franceses
text: Un a√±o y medio despu√©s de la final del Mundial de Qatar, Emiliano Mart√≠nez sigue siendo una pesadilla para los franceses. "Dibu" fue figura en la clasificaci√≥n de Aston Villa a semifinales de la Europa League, atajando dos penales en la definici√≥n contra Lille y celebrando con su particular baile de cara a la tribuna, desde lo insultaron a lo largo de todo el partido. Ya desde la previa se anticipaba un ambiente hostil para Mart√≠nez, en su primer partido en Francia despu√©s de la final del Mundial. "El enemigo p√∫blico n√∫mero 1. Los franceses tendr√°n una oportunidad real de expresar algo de su enojo anterior. Su actuaci√≥n por s√≠ sola lo hubiera convertido en una figura despreciada en Francia, pero fue su reacci√≥n durante las celebraciones lo que ciment√≥ su reputaci√≥n vilipendiada y r√°pidamente le vali√≥ el apodo de 'el argentino m√°s odiado de Francia'", hab√≠a publicado la prensa local. Ciertamente, fue lo que ocurri√≥. Una contundente silbatina se escuch√≥ cada vez que el arquero surgido de Independiente intervino en el juego. A√∫n peor fue cuando "Dibu" fue amonestado a los 38 minutos del primer tiempo por demorar el juego. Sin embargo, al arquero no parec√≠an no afectarle en lo m√°s m√≠nimo los insultos ni los silbidos. Lille se impuso finalmente 2-1 y llev√≥ el global a 3-3, por lo que hubo definici√≥n por penales. Y all√≠, Mart√≠nez tuvo oportunidad de responderle al p√∫blico franc√©s. Despu√©s de adivinarle el primer disparo a Nabil Bentaleb, el arquero se dio vuelta hacia la tribuna e hizo el gesto de silencio, lo que provoc√≥ la reacci√≥n del p√∫blico y tambi√©n la del √°rbitro, que le mostr√≥ la tarjeta amarilla por segunda vez. Sin embargo, "Dibu" no se fue expulsado, ya que en virtud de cambios reglamentarios recientes, las amarillas que se reciben durante el partido son independientes de las que se muestran en las tandas de penales. Finalmente, tras atajar el remate de Benjamin Andr√© y sellar la clasificaci√≥n de Aston Villa, Mart√≠nez dio rienda suelta a su locura y volvi√≥ a dedicarle su particular baile al p√∫blico franc√©s antes de unirse a sus compa√±eros en el festejo.

author: Alfredo Boada Mola
title: Pronostican lluvias y tormentas el√©ctricas en gran parte de Cuba
text:
La alerta se√±ala que se incrementar√°n las √°reas de nublados con chubascos, lluvias y tormentas el√©ctricas que pueden llegar a ser fuertes e intensas en algunas localidades, en las regiones oriental y central de Cuba.
Apunt√≥ la instituci√≥n meteorol√≥gica que el mal tiempo cubrir√† la parte occidental de s√†bado a domingo.
En las √°reas de chubascos y tormentas el√©ctricas pueden ocurrir rachas de vientos fuertes e incluso tormentas locales severas, a√±adi√≥ el parte.
Se debe prestar mucha atenci√≥n a las inundaciones que pudieran generarse en zonas bajas y de mal drenaje, indicaron los expertos.
Las lluvias, que ser√°n el elemento m√°s importante para Cuba, estar√°n asociadas con la activa onda tropical que se localiza ahora sobre la Rep√∫blica Dominicana.
Este sistema tiene asociado una extensa √°rea de nublados con chubascos, lluvias y tormentas el√©ctricas sobre La Espa√±ola, Las Bahamas meridionales, los mares adyacentes y la porci√≥n norte del Mar Caribe oriental.
En las pr√≥ximas 24 a 48 horas, se formar√° una zona de bajas presiones en el seno de la onda tropical, pr√≥xima o sobre el territorio nacional, advirtieron los meteor√≥logos.
Este sistema se desplazar√° entre el oeste y oeste-noroeste sobre el oriente de Cuba ma√±ana viernes 2 y sobre el centro y occidente del pa√≠s el s√°bado 3.
Dicha baja se internar√° desde la tarde del s√°bado en el Estrecho de la Florida y posteriormente en el sudeste del Golfo de M√©xico, donde pudiera encontrar condiciones favorables para el desarrollo cicl√≥nico tropical y convertirse en una Depresi√≥n Tropical o Tormenta Tropical, con un movimiento m√°s al noroeste a partir del domingo 4.
El Centro de Pron√≥sticos del Instituto de Meteorolog√≠a, mantendr√° una estrecha vigilancia sobre este sistema, dada su trayectoria pronosticada pr√≥xima o sobre Cuba y las condiciones oce√°nicas y atmosf√©ricas algo favorables para el desarrollo cicl√≥nico tropical.
arc/abm
